iptables.description: Kubernetes cluster kube-proxy customization of iptables specific config (durations format is RFC3339 duration, e.g. `PT60S`)

ipvs.description: Kubernetes cluster kube-proxy customization of IPVS specific config (durations format is [RFC3339](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3339) duration, e.g. `PT60S`)

minSyncPeriod.description: Minimum period that IPVS rules are refreshed in [RFC3339](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3339) duration (e.g. `PT60S`).

syncPeriod.description: Minimum period that IPVS rules are refreshed, in [RFC3339](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3339) duration format (e.g. `PT60S`).

syncPeriod.description: Minimum period that IPVS rules are refreshed, in [RFC3339](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3339) duration format (e.g. `PT60S`).

tcpFinTimeout.description: Timeout value used for IPVS TCP sessions after receiving a FIN in RFC3339 duration (e.g. `PT60S`). The default value is `PT0S`, which preserves the current timeout value on the system.

tcpTimeout.description: Timeout value used for idle IPVS TCP sessions in [RFC3339](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3339) duration (e.g. `PT60S`). The default value is `PT0S`, which preserves the current timeout value on the system.

udpTimeout.description: timeout value used for IPVS UDP packets in [RFC3339](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3339) duration (e.g. `PT60S`). The default value is `PT0S`, which preserves the current timeout value on the system.

provider.description:
The provider type for the ovh package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

ovh:CloudProject/containerRegistry:Conta.description:
Creates a container registry associated with a public cloud project.

## Example Usage

```hcl
data "ovh_cloud_project_capabilities_containerregistry_filter" "regcap" {
  service_name = "XXXXXX"
  plan_name    = "SMALL"
  region       = "GRA"
}

resource "ovh_cloud_project_containerregistry" "reg" {
  service_name = data.ovh_cloud_project_capabilities_containerregistry_filter.regcap.service_name
  plan_id      = data.ovh_cloud_project_capabilities_containerregistry_filter.regcap.id
  region       = data.ovh_cloud_project_capabilities_containerregistry_filter.regcap.region
  name         = "mydockerregistry"
}
```

> __WARNING__ You can update and migrate to a higher plan at any time but not the contrary.

createdAt.description: Plan creation date

region.description: Region of the registry

serviceName.description:
The id of the public cloud project. If omitted,
the `OVH_CLOUD_PROJECT_SERVICE` environment variable is used.

ovh:CloudProject/containerRegistryUser:C.description:
Creates a user for a container registry associated with a public cloud project.

## Example Usage

```hcl
data "ovh_cloud_project_containerregistry" "registry" {
  service_name = "XXXXXX"
  registry_id  = "yyyy"
}

resource "ovh_cloud_project_containerregistry_user" "user" {
  service_name = ovh_cloud_project_containerregistry.registry.service_name
  registry_id  = ovh_cloud_project_containerregistry.registry.id
  email        = "foo@bar.com"
  login        = "foobar"
}
```

ovh:CloudProject/failoverIpAttach:Failov.description:
Attaches a failover IP address to a compute instance

## Example Usage

```hcl
resource "ovh_cloud_project_failover_ip_attach" "myfailoverip" {
  service_name = "XXXXXX"
  ip           = "XXXXXX"
  routed_to    = "XXXXXX"
}
```

ovh:CloudProject/kube:Kube.description:
## Import

OVHcloud Managed Kubernetes Service clusters can be imported using the `service_name` and the `id` of the cluster, separated by "/" E.g., bash <break><break>```sh<break> $ pulumi import ovh:CloudProject/kube:Kube my_kube_cluster service_name/kube_id <break>```<break><break>

customizations.description: **Deprecated** (Optional) Use `customization_apiserver` and `customization_kube_proxy` instead. Kubernetes cluster customization

isUpToDate.description: True if all nodes and control-plane are up-to-date.

kubeProxyMode.description: Selected mode for kube-proxy. **Changing this value recreates the resource, including ETCD user data.** Defaults to `iptables`.

kubeconfig.description: The kubeconfig file. Use this file to connect to your kubernetes cluster.

name.description: The name of the kubernetes cluster.

privateNetworkId.description:
OpenStack private network (or vRack) ID to use. **Changing this value recreates the resource, including ETCD user data.** Defaults - not use private network.

> __WARNING__ Updating the private network ID resets the cluster so that all user data is deleted.

region.description: a valid OVHcloud public cloud region ID in which the kubernetes cluster will be available. Ex.: "GRA1". Defaults to all public cloud regions. **Changing this value recreates the resource.**

serviceName.description: The id of the public cloud project. If omitted, the `OVH_CLOUD_PROJECT_SERVICE` environment variable is used. **Changing this value recreates the resource.**

status.description: Cluster status. Should be normally set to 'READY'.

updatePolicy.description: Cluster update policy. Choose between [ALWAYS_UPDATE, MINIMAL_DOWNTIME, NEVER_UPDATE].

ovh:CloudProject/kubeIpRestrictions:Kube.description:
Apply IP restrictions to an OVHcloud Managed Kubernetes cluster.

## Example Usage

```hcl
resource "ovh_cloud_project_kube_iprestrictions" "vrack_only" {
  service_name = "xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx"
  kube_id      = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxx"
  ips          = ["10.42.0.0/16"]
}
```

ovh:CloudProject/kubeOidc:KubeOidc.description:
Creates an OIDC configuration in an OVHcloud Managed Kubernetes cluster.

## Example Usage

```hcl
resource "ovh_cloud_project_kube_oidc" "my-oidc" {
  service_name = var.projectid
  kube_id      = ovh_cloud_project_kube.mykube.id

  #required field
  client_id    = "xxx"
  issuer_url   = "https://ovh.com"

  #optional field
  oidc_username_claim  = "an-email"
  oidc_username_prefix = "ovh:"
  oidc_groups_claim    = ["groups"]
  oidc_groups_prefix   = "ovh:"
  oidc_required_claim  = ["claim1=val1"]
  oidc_signing_algs    = ["RS512"]
  oidc_ca_content      = ""
}
```

## Import

OVHcloud Managed Kubernetes Service cluster OIDC can be imported using the tenant `service_name` and cluster id `kube_id` separated by "/" E.g., bash <break><break>```sh<break> $ pulumi import ovh:CloudProject/kubeOidc:KubeOidc my-oidc service_name/kube_id <break>```<break><break>

serviceName.description: The ID of the public cloud project. If omitted, the `OVH_CLOUD_PROJECT_SERVICE` environment variable is used. **Changing this value recreates the resource.**

ovh:CloudProject/regionStoragePresign:Re.description:
Generates a temporary presigned S3 URLs to download or upload an object.

> __NOTE__ This resource is only compatible with the `High Performance - S3` solution for object storage.

## Example Usage

```hcl
resource "ovh_cloud_project_region_storage_presign" "presigned_url" {
  service_name = "xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx"
  region_name  = "GRA"
  name         = "s3-bucket-name"
  expire       = 3600
  method       = "GET"
  object       = "an-object-in-the-bucket"
}

output "presigned_url" {
  value = ovh_cloud_project_region_storage_presign.presigned_url.url
}
```

method.description: The method you want to use to interact with your object. Can be either 'GET' or 'PUT'.

name.description: The name of your S3 storage container/bucket.

object.description: The name of the object in your S3 bucket.

regionName.description:
The region in which your storage is located.
Ex.: "GRA".

ovh:CloudProject/s3Credential:S3Credenti.description:

```hcl
resource "ovh_cloud_project_user" "user" {
  service_name = "XXX
  description  = "my user for acceptance tests"
  role_names   = [
    "objectstore_operator"
  ]
}

resource "ovh_cloud_project_user_s3_credential" "my_s3_credentials" {
  service_name = ovh_cloud_project_user.user.service_name
  user_id      = ovh_cloud_project_user.user.id
}
```

ovh:CloudProject/workflowBackup:Workflow.description:
Manage a worflow that schedules backups of public cloud instance.
Note that upon deletion, the workflow is deleted but any backups that have been created by this workflow are not. 

## Example Usage

```hcl
resource "ovh_cloud_project_workflow_backup" "my_backup" {
  service_name        = "xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx"
  region_name         = "GRA11"
  cron                = "50 4 * * *"
  instance_id         = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxx"
  max_execution_count = "0"
  name                = "Backup workflow for instance"
  rotation            = "7"
}
```

backupName.description: The name of the backup files that are created. If empty, the `name` attribute is used.

cron.description: The cron periodicity at which the backup workflow is scheduled

maxExecutionCount.description: The number of times the worflow is run. Default value is `0` which means that the workflow will be scheduled continously until its deletion

name.description: The worflow name that is used in the UI

regionName.description: The name of the openstack region.

rotation.description: The number of backup that are retained.

serviceName.description: The id of the public cloud project. If omitted, the `OVH_CLOUD_PROJECT_SERVICE` environment variable is used.

ovh:CloudProjectDatabase/databaseInstanc.description:
Creates a database for a database cluster associated with a public cloud project.

With this resource you can create a database for the following database engine:

  * `mysql`
  * `postgresql`

## Example Usage

```hcl
data "ovh_cloud_project_database" "db" {
  service_name  = "XXXX"
  engine        = "YYYY"
  id            = "ZZZZ"
}

resource "ovh_cloud_project_database_database" "database" {
  service_name  = data.ovh_cloud_project_database.db.service_name
  engine        = data.ovh_cloud_project_database.db.engine
  cluster_id    = data.ovh_cloud_project_database.db.id
  name          = "mydatabase"
}
```

## Import

OVHcloud Managed database clusters databases can be imported using the `service_name`, `engine`, `cluster_id` and `id` of the database, separated by "/" E.g., bash <break><break>```sh<break> $ pulumi import ovh:CloudProjectDatabase/databaseInstance:DatabaseInstance my_database service_name/engine/cluster_id/id <break>```<break><break>

ovh:CloudProjectDatabase/integration:Int.description:
Creates an integration for a database cluster associated with a public cloud project.

With this resource you can create an integration for all engine exept `mongodb`.

Please take a look at the list of available `types` in the `Argument references` section in order to know the list of avaulable integrations. For example, thanks to the integration feature you can have your PostgreSQL logs in your OpenSearch Database.

## Example Usage

Push PostgreSQL logs in an OpenSearch DB:

```hcl
data "ovh_cloud_project_database" "dbpostgresql" {
  service_name  = "XXXX"
  engine        = "postgresql"
  id            = "ZZZZ"
}

data "ovh_cloud_project_database" "dbopensearch" {
  service_name  = "XXXX"
  engine        = "opensearch"
  id            = "ZZZZ"
}

resource "ovh_cloud_project_database_integration" "integration" {
  service_name            = data.ovh_cloud_project_database.dbpostgresql.service_name
  engine                  = data.ovh_cloud_project_database.dbpostgresql.engine
  cluster_id              = data.ovh_cloud_project_database.dbpostgresql.id
  source_service_id       = data.ovh_cloud_project_database.dbpostgresql.id
  destination_service_id  = data.ovh_cloud_project_database.dbopensearch.id
  type                    = "opensearchLogs"
}
```

## Import

OVHcloud Managed database clusters users can be imported using the `service_name`, `engine`, `cluster_id` and `id` of the user, separated by "/" E.g., bash <break><break>```sh<break> $ pulumi import ovh:CloudProjectDatabase/integration:Integration my_user service_name/engine/cluster_id/id <break>```<break><break>

resolution.description: Resolution for an aggregated namespace. Should follow Rfc3339 e.g P2D, PT48H.

retentionBlockDataExpirationDuration.description: Controls how long we wait before expiring stale data. Should follow Rfc3339 e.g P2D, PT48H.

retentionBlockSizeDuration.description: Controls how long to keep a block in memory before flushing to a fileset on disk. Should follow Rfc3339 e.g P2D, PT48H.

retentionBufferFutureDuration.description: Controls how far into the future writes to the namespace will be accepted. Should follow Rfc3339 e.g P2D, PT48H.

retentionBufferPastDuration.description: Controls how far into the past writes to the namespace will be accepted. Should follow Rfc3339 e.g P2D, PT48H.

retentionPeriodDuration.description: Controls the duration of time that M3DB will retain data for the namespace. Should follow Rfc3339 e.g P2D, PT48H.

serviceName.description:
The id of the public cloud project. If omitted,
the `OVH_CLOUD_PROJECT_SERVICE` environment variable is used.

snapshotEnabled.description: Defines whether M3DB will create snapshot files for this namespace.

writesToCommitLogEnabled.description: Defines whether M3DB will include writes to this namespace in the commit log.

ovh:Iam/policy:Policy.description:
Creates an IAM policy.

## Important

> Using this resource requires that the account is enrolled in the OVHcloud [IAM beta](https://labs.ovhcloud.com/en/iam/) 


## Example Usage

```hcl
data "ovh_me" "account" {}

resource "ovh_me_identity_group" "my_group" {
  name        = "my_group"
  description = "my_group created in Terraform"
}

resource "ovh_iam_policy" "manager" {
  name        = "allow_ovh_manager"
  description = "Users are allowed to use the OVH manager"
  identities  = [ovh_me_identity_group.my_group.urn]
  resources   = [data.ovh_me.account.urn]
  # these are all the actions 
  allow = [
    "account:apiovh:me/get",
    "account:apiovh:me/supportLevel/get",
    "account:apiovh:me/certificates/get",
    "account:apiovh:me/tag/get",
    "account:apiovh:services/get",
    "account:apiovh:*",
  ]
}
```

allows.description: List of actions allowed on resources by identities

createdAt.description: Creation date of this group.

excepts.description: List of overrides of action that must not be allowed even if they are caught by allow. Only makes sens if allow contains wildcards.

identities.description: List of identities affected by the policy

name.description: Name of the policy, must be unique

readOnly.description: Indicates that the policy is a default one.

resources.description: List of resources affected by the policy

updatedAt.description: Date of the last update of this group.

ovh:IpLoadBalancing/httpFrontend:HttpFro.description:
Creates a backend HTTP server group (frontend) to be used by loadbalancing frontend(s)

## Example Usage

```hcl
data "ovh_iploadbalancing" "lb" {
  service_name = "ip-1.2.3.4"
  state        = "ok"
}

resource "ovh_iploadbalancing_http_farm" "farm80" {
  service_name = "${data.ovh_iploadbalancing.lb.service_name}"
  display_name = "ingress-8080-gra"
  zone         = "all"
  port         = 80
}

resource "ovh_iploadbalancing_http_frontend" "testfrontend" {
  service_name    = "${data.ovh_iploadbalancing.lb.service_name}"
  display_name    = "ingress-8080-gra"
  zone            = "all"
  port            = "80,443"
  default_farm_id = "${ovh_iploadbalancing_http_farm.farm80.id}"
}
```


### With HTTP Header

```
data "ovh_iploadbalancing" "lb" {
  service_name = "ip-1.2.3.4"
  state        = "ok"
}

resource "ovh_iploadbalancing_http_farm" "farm80" {
  service_name = "${data.ovh_iploadbalancing.lb.service_name}"
  display_name = "ingress-8080-gra"
  zone         = "all"
  port         = 80
}

resource "ovh_iploadbalancing_http_frontend" "testfrontend" {
  service_name    = "${data.ovh_iploadbalancing.lb.service_name}"
  display_name    = "ingress-8080-gra"
  zone            = "all"
  port            = "80,443"
  default_farm_id = "${ovh_iploadbalancing_http_farm.farm80.id}"
  http_header     = ["X-Ip-Header %%ci", "X-Port-Header %%cp"]
}
```

```hcl
resource "ovh_iploadbalancing_http_route" "httpsredirect" {

}
```

ovh:IpLoadBalancing/httpRouteRule:HttpRo.description:
Manage rules for HTTP route.

## Example Usage

Route which redirect all URL to HTTPs for example.com (Vhost).

```hcl
resource "ovh_iploadbalancing_http_route" "httpsredirect" {
  service_name = "loadbalancer-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx"
  display_name = "Redirect to HTTPS"
  weight       = 1
  frontend_id  = 11111

  action {
    status = 302
    target = "https://$${host}$${path}$${arguments}"
    type   = "redirect"
  }
}

resource "ovh_iploadbalancing_http_route_rule" "examplerule" {
  service_name = "loadbalancer-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx"
  route_id     = "${ovh_iploadbalancing_http_route.httpsredirect.id}"
  display_name = "Match example.com host"
  field        = "host"
  match        = "is"
  negate       = false
  pattern      = "example.com"
}
```

Rule which match a specific header (same effect as the host match above).

```hcl
resource "ovh_iploadbalancing_http_route_rule" "examplerule" {
  service_name = "loadbalancer-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx"
  route_id     = "${ovh_iploadbalancing_http_route.httpsredirect.id}"
  display_name = "Match example.com Host header"
  field        = "headers"
  match        = "is"
  negate       = false
  pattern      = "example.com"
  sub_field    = "Host"
}
```

ovh:IpLoadBalancing/refresh:Refresh.description:
Applies changes from other `ovh_iploadbalancing_*` resources to the production configuration of loadbalancers.

## Example Usage

```hcl
data "ovh_iploadbalancing" "lb" {
  service_name = "ip-1.2.3.4"
  state        = "ok"
}

resource "ovh_iploadbalancing_tcp_farm" "farmname" {
  service_name = "${data.ovh_iploadbalancing.lb.service_name}"
  port         = 8080
  zone         = "all"
}

resource "ovh_iploadbalancing_tcp_farm_server" "backend" {
  service_name           = "${data.ovh_iploadbalancing.lb.service_name}"
  farm_id                = "${ovh_iploadbalancing_tcp_farm.farmname.id}"
  display_name           = "mybackend"
  address                = "4.5.6.7"
  status                 = "active"
  port                   = 80
  proxy_protocol_version = "v2"
  weight                 = 2
  probe                  = true
  ssl                    = false
  backup                 = true
}

resource "ovh_iploadbalancing_refresh" "mylb" {
  service_name = "${data.ovh_iploadbalancing.lb.service_name}"
  keepers = [
    "${ovh_iploadbalancing_tcp_farm_server.backend.*.address}",
  ]
}
```

ovh:Me/installationTemplate:Installation.description:
Use this resource to create a custom installation template available for dedicated servers.

## Example Usage

```hcl
resource "ovh_me_installation_template" "mytemplate" {
  base_template_name = "centos7_64"
  template_name      = "mytemplate"
  default_language   = "en"
}
```

## Import

Custom installation template available for dedicated servers can be imported using the `base_template_name`, `template_name` of the cluster, separated by "/" E.g., bash <break><break>```sh<break> $ pulumi import ovh:Me/installationTemplate:InstallationTemplate mytemplate base_template_name/template_name <break>```<break><break>

defaultLanguage.description: The default language of this template.

hardRaidConfiguration.description: This distribution supports hardware raid configuration through the OVHcloud API.

lastModification.description: Date of last modification of the base image.

lvmReady.description: This distribution supports Logical Volumes (Linux LVM)

removeDefaultPartitionSchemes.description: Remove default partition schemes at creation.

supportsDistributionKernel.description: This distribution supports installation using the distribution's native kernel instead of the recommended OVHcloud kernel.

supportsSqlServer.description: This distribution supports the microsoft SQL server.

Use this resource to create partition scheme for a custom installation template available for dedicated servers.

```hcl
resource "ovh_me_installation_template" "mytemplate" {

  template_name      = "mytemplate"

}

  template_name = ovh_me_installation_template.mytemplate.template_name

}
```

## Import

The resource can be imported using the `template_name`, `name` of the cluster, separated by "/" E.g., bash <break><break>```sh<break> $ pulumi import ovh:Me/installationTemplatePartitionScheme:InstallationTemplatePartitionScheme scheme template_name/name <break>```<break><break>

ovh:Me/installationTemplatePartitionSche.description:
Use this resource to create a hardware raid group in the partition scheme of a custom installation template available for dedicated servers.

## Example Usage

```hcl
resource "ovh_me_installation_template" "mytemplate" {
  base_template_name = "centos7_64"
  template_name      = "mytemplate"
  default_language   = "fr"
}

resource "ovh_me_installation_template_partition_scheme" "scheme" {
  template_name = ovh_me_installation_template.mytemplate.template_name
  name          = "myscheme"
  priority      = 1
}

resource "ovh_me_installation_template_partition_scheme_hardware_raid" "group1" {
  template_name = ovh_me_installation_template_partition_scheme.scheme.template_name
  scheme_name   = ovh_me_installation_template_partition_scheme.scheme.name
  name          = "group1"
  disks         = ["[c1:d1,c1:d2,c1:d3]", "[c1:d10,c1:d20,c1:d30]"]
  mode          = "raid50"
  step          = 1
}
```

## Import

The resource can be imported using the `template_name`, `scheme_name`, `name` of the cluster, separated by "/" E.g., bash <break><break>```sh<break> $ pulumi import ovh:Me/installationTemplatePartitionSchemeHardwareRaid:InstallationTemplatePartitionSchemeHardwareRaid group1 template_name/scheme_name/name <break>```<break><break>

disks.description: Disk List. Syntax is cX:dY for disks and [cX:dY,cX:dY] for groups. With X and Y resp. the controller id and the disk id.

mode.description: RAID mode (raid0, raid1, raid10, raid5, raid50, raid6, raid60).

step.description: Specifies the creation order of the hardware RAID.

templateName.description: The template name of the partition scheme.

ovh:Me/installationTemplatePartitionSche.description:
Use this resource to create a partition in the partition scheme of a custom installation template available for dedicated servers.

## Example Usage

```hcl
resource "ovh_me_installation_template" "mytemplate" {
  base_template_name = "centos7_64"
  template_name      = "mytemplate"
  default_language   = "fr"
}

resource "ovh_me_installation_template_partition_scheme" "scheme" {
  template_name = ovh_me_installation_template.mytemplate.template_name
  name          = "myscheme"
  priority      = 1
}

resource "ovh_me_installation_template_partition_scheme_partition" "root" {
  template_name = ovh_me_installation_template_partition_scheme.scheme.template_name
  scheme_name   = ovh_me_installation_template_partition_scheme.scheme.name
  mountpoint    = "/"
  filesystem    = "ext4"
  size          = "400"
  order         = 1
  type          = "primary"
}
```

## Import

The resource can be imported using the `template_name`, `scheme_name`, `mountpoint` of the cluster, separated by "/" E.g., bash <break><break>```sh<break> $ pulumi import ovh:Me/installationTemplatePartitionSchemePartition:InstallationTemplatePartitionSchemePartition root template_name/scheme_name/mountpoint <break>```<break><break>

ovh:CloudProject/getRegion:getRegion.description:
Use this data source to retrieve information about a region associated with a public cloud project. The region must be associated with the project.

## Example Usage

```hcl
data "ovh_cloud_project_region" "GRA1" {
  service_name = "XXXXXX"
  name         = "GRA1"
}
```

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getRegion.

name.description:
The name of the region associated with the public cloud
project.

serviceName.description:
The id of the public cloud project. If omitted,
the `OVH_CLOUD_PROJECT_SERVICE` environment variable is used.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getRegion.

continentCode.description:
the code of the geographic continent the region is running.
E.g.: EU for Europe, US for America...

datacenterLocation.description:
The location code of the datacenter.
E.g.: "GRA", meaning Gravelines, for region "GRA1"

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

name.description: the name of the public cloud service

services.description: The list of public cloud services running within the region

ovh:CloudProject/getRegions:getRegions.description:
Use this data source to get the regions of a public cloud project.

## Example Usage

```hcl
data "ovh_cloud_project_regions" "regions" {
  service_name    = "XXXXXX"
  has_services_up = ["network"]
}
```

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getRegions.

hasServicesUps.description:
List of services which has to be UP in regions.
Example: "image", "instance", "network", "storage", "volume", "workflow", ...
If left blank, returns all regions associated with the service_name.

serviceName.description:
The id of the public cloud project. If omitted,
the `OVH_CLOUD_PROJECT_SERVICE` environment variable is used.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getRegions.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

names.description: The list of regions associated with the project, filtered by services UP.

ovh:Dbaas/getLogsCluster:getLogsCluster.description:
Use this data source to retrieve informations about a DBaas logs cluster tenant.

## Example Usage

```hcl
data "ovh_dbaas_logs_cluster" "logstash" {
  service_name = "ldp-xx-xxxxx"
}
```

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getLogsCluster.

serviceName.description: The service name. It's the ID of your Logs Data Platform instance.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getLogsCluster.

archiveAllowedNetworks.description: is allowed networks for ARCHIVE flow type

clusterType.description: is type of cluster (DEDICATED, PRO or TRIAL)

directInputAllowedNetworks.description: is allowed networks for DIRECT_INPUT flow type

hostname.description: is cluster hostname hosting the tenant

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

isDefault.description: is true if all content generated by given service will be placed on this cluster

isUnlocked.description: is true if given service can perform advanced operations on cluster

queryAllowedNetworks.description: is allowed networks for QUERY flow type

region.description: is datacenter localization

urn.description: is the URN of the DBaas logs instance

ovh:Dbaas/getLogsInputEngine:getLogsInpu.description:
Use this data source to retrieve information about a DBaas logs input engine.

## Example Usage

```hcl
data "ovh_dbaas_logs_input_engine" "logstash" {
  service_name = "ldp-xx-xxxxx"
  name          = "logstash"
  version       = "6.8"
  is_deprecated = true
}
```

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getLogsInputEngine.

isDeprecated.description: Indicates if engine will soon not be supported.

name.description: The name of the logs input engine.

serviceName.description: The service name. It's the ID of your Logs Data Platform instance.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getLogsInputEngine.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

Use this data source to retrieve information about an IP Load Balancing product

## Example Usage

```hcl
data "ovh_iploadbalancing" "lb" {
  service_name = "XXXXXX"
  state        = "ok"
}
```

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getIpLoadBalancing.

displayName.description: the name displayed in ManagerV6 for your iplb (max 50 chars)

ipv4.description: The IPV4 associated to your IP load balancing

ipv6.description: The IPV6 associated to your IP load balancing

offer.description: The offer of your IP load balancing

serviceName.description: The internal name of your IP load balancing

sslConfiguration.description:
Modern oldest compatible clients : Firefox 27, Chrome 30,
IE 11 on Windows 7, Edge, Opera 17, Safari 9, Android 5.0, and Java 8.
Intermediate oldest compatible clients : Firefox 1, Chrome 1, IE 7, Opera 5,
Safari 1, Windows XP IE8, Android 2.3, Java 7.
Can take any of the following value: "intermediate", "modern"

state.description:
Current state of your IP. Can take any of the following value:
"blacklisted", "deleted", "free", "ok", "quarantined", "suspended"

vrackEligibility.description: Vrack eligibility. Takes a boolean value.

vrackName.description:
Name of the vRack on which the current Load Balancer is
attached to, as it is named on vRack product

zones.description: Location where your service is. This takes an array of values.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getIpLoadBalancing.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

metricsToken.description:
The metrics token associated with your IP load balancing
This attribute is sensitive.

orderableZones.description: Available additional zone for your Load Balancer

urn.description: The URN of the load balancer, to be used in IAM policies

ovh:index/getServers:getServers.description:
Use this data source to get the list of dedicated servers associated with your OVHcloud Account.

## Example Usage

```hcl
data "ovh_dedicated_servers" "servers" {}
```

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getServers.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

results.description: The list of dedicated servers IDs associated with your OVHcloud Account.

ovh:index/getVrackNetworks:getVrackNetwo.description:
Use this data source to get the list of Vrack network ids available for your IPLoadbalancer associated with your OVHcloud account.

## Example Usage

```hcl
data ovh_iploadbalancing_vrack_networks "lb_networks" {
  service_name = "XXXXXX"
  subnet       = "10.0.0.0/24"
}
```

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getVrackNetworks.

serviceName.description: The internal name of your IP load balancing

vlanId.description: Filters networks on the vlan id.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getVrackNetworks.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

results.description: The list of vrack network ids.
